definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Ask to be with Tony Leung's joint property?
sentences.chinese: 問到可有跟梁朝偉的聯名物業？

sentences.english: We go hand in hand banks, savings deposit every month love to give our future little Baby.
sentences.chinese: 我們有聯名戶頭，每月存錢給我們未來的小寶貝。

sentences.english: We wrote a letter in joint names.
I have a joint account with my wife.
sentences.chinese: 我和我妻子有一個聯名賬戶。

sentences.english: With a co-branded line of frozen cannoli?
sentences.chinese: 通過冷凍奶酷卷的聯名生產線嗎？

sentences.english: I'd like to have a joint account for my husband and myself.
sentences.chinese: 我想開一個我和我丈夫的聯名帳戶。

definition: lit. to join hands/to act together
to belong or be dedicated exclusively to/proprietary/private/personal
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it
